Class DataBaseHelper

java.lang.Object
android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
com.example.studious.DataBaseHelper
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class DataBaseHelper extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
responsible for managing the SQLite database
Version:
Release 1
Author:
Ben Allen, Devin Elenbaase, Bryan VanDyke

  • Constructor Details

    • DataBaseHelper

      public DataBaseHelper(@Nullable android.content.Context context)
      Constructor a new database helper.
      Parameters:
      context - Interface to global information about an application environment.

    • DataBaseHelper

      public DataBaseHelper(@Nullable android.content.Context context, @Nullable String name, @Nullable android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.CursorFactory factory, int version)
      Constructor a new database helper.
      Parameters:
      context - Interface to global information about an application environment. Used to get paths to db.
      name - Database name to open or create. null for in memory db.
      factory - used for creating cursor objects. null for default.
      version - Database version. If the db is older onUpgrade is called.

    • onUpgrade

      public void onUpgrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase sqLiteDatabase, int oldVersion, int newVersion)
      database version (most likely the schema) changed. update to new db.
      Specified by:
      onUpgrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      Parameters:
      sqLiteDatabase - SQLiteDatabase. the db.
      oldVersion - The version of the db we opened.
      newVersion - The current version of the database for this app.

    • addItem

      public long addItem(Items items)
      Insert one item of data into database. Let ContentValues and SQLiteDatabase handle all the backend sql type stuff.
      Parameters:
      items - data to be inserted
      Returns:
      row id newly inserted row, -1 if and error occurred.

    • updateItem

      Update data in one row
      Parameters:
      item - data in Items format
      Returns:
      true if row was updated

      Returns:
